Methods for PCA eigen values

A set of functions around PCA/LDA eigen/trace. scree calculates their proportion and cumulated proportion; scree_min returns the minimal number of axis to use to retain a given proportion; scree_plot displays a screeplot.

scree(x, nax)

# S3 method for PCA
scree(x, nax = 1:10)

# S3 method for LDA
scree(x, nax = 1:10)

scree_min(x, prop = 0.99)

scree_plot(x, nax = 1:10)

Arguments

x

a PCA object
nax

numeric range of axis to consider
prop

numeric how many axis are enough this proportion of variance, if too high then number of axis is returned.

Value

scree returns a data.frame, scree_min a numeric, scree_plot a ggplot.

Examples

# On PCA
bp <- PCA(efourier(bot))
#> you selected `norm=TRUE`, which is not recommended. See ?efourier
#> 99% 
#>  10 
#> 'nb.h' not provided and set to 10 (99% harmonic power)
scree(bp)
#> # A tibble: 10 x 3
#>    axis  proportion cumsum
#>    <ord>      <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1 1        0.761    0.761
#>  2 2        0.170    0.931
#>  3 3        0.0294   0.960
#>  4 4        0.0135   0.974
#>  5 5        0.00860  0.982
#>  6 6        0.00719  0.990
#>  7 7        0.00306  0.993
#>  8 8        0.00190  0.994
#>  9 9        0.00159  0.996
#> 10 10       0.00122  0.997
scree_min(bp, 0.99)
#> [1] 7
scree_min(bp, 1)
#> [1] 10

scree_plot(bp)
scree_plot(bp, 1:5)

# on LDA, it uses svd
bl <- LDA(PCA(opoly(olea)), "var")
#> 'nb.pts' missing and set to 91
#> 'degree' missing and set to 5
#> 4 PC retained
scree(bl)
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>   axis  proportion cumsum
#>   <ord>      <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 1         0.913   0.913
#> 2 2         0.0603  0.973
#> 3 3         0.0268  1.000
